#  Visitor Management

Create and automate a professional, safe, and inviting visitor experience with
our visitor management systems and solutions.

Overview

Overview Benefits Resources FAQs

Get a Quote

##  Visitor Management Systems to Power a Safer Workplace

Managing who enters and leaves your building can be quite time-consuming and
costly. And without automation, you could have long wait times and a
cumbersome process for your visitors, which leads to a poor experience.

##  Protect Your People and Your Property

Know exactly who is entering and exiting your facility. Gain confidence that
all those entering meet your protocols and criteria to ensure a safe workplace
environment.



##  Streamline the Visitor Experience

Save time and money by eliminating manual steps and the need for paper or
dedicated staff by streamlining and digitizing processes, workflows, and
reports.

##  Scalable for Your Evolving Business

The market and your business processes are ever-changing. You need a visitor
solution that is scalable and flexible to meet these new demands to help
provide a healthy, safe, and secure workplace.



##  Manage Your Workplace

Securitas Technology Visitor Management technology also empowers you to manage
the workplace for safety and efficiency. Workplace Management solutions help
streamline daily screening and tasks like workspace reservation.



Benefits

##  The Advantages of Visitor Management

Start with one location or one hundred — Visitor management can grow as your
business grows.

###  Simple, Flexible & Scalable

Meet the needs of today and prepare for tomorrow with a flexible system you
can scale depending on your requirements.

###  Automated Reporting & Dashboards

Use the activity dashboard to monitor visitors and employees in real-time.
Quickly notify your staff when a potential threat is detected.

###  Ensure Compliance

Implement the signing of a waiver as part of your visitor management system.

###  Decrease Administrative Costs

Save time and money by automating visitor management, eliminating the need to
manually screen and record each visitor.

Show More

Why Securitas Technology?

##  Experts in Visitor Management Solutions

  * One Integrated System
  * Committed to Quality
  * Expertise Across Industries

Creating a Unified Ecosystem

As with any tailored solution, there is no “one size fits all” system.
Customer requirements, physical building attributes and assets can all change
how our security experts approach designing your security system. Whether your
institution has an existing system in place or you need to start from scratch,
our experts will work with your in-house teams to ensure your needs are met
and you have a fully integrated system.

Finding the right solution for your business requires an in-depth
understanding of the needs of your organization. Our security experts work
closely with you to learn your specific requirements and consider your needs
for scalability, functionality, features, and any special requirements before
proposing the most cost-effective solution.

Our knowledgable, certified security professionals have worked with clients

government agencies. This range of expertise across industries gives us the
experience needed to identify security issues for any type of facility, and
recommend effective solutions.

##  FAQs

  * 01
  * 02
  * 03

  * 01
  * 02
  * 03

What is visitor management?

Visitor management is the proactive screening of every individual who crosses
your organization’s threshold. There are different methods for visitor
screening, from I.D. badges to electronic registration.  

What is visitor management software?

Visitor management software is a way to digitize how organizations manage and
track visitors. Different components can include:

  * I.D. Scanning 

  * Electronic logbooks 

  * Facial recognition technology 

  * Mobile-card readers

How does a visitor management system work?

A visitor management system is a cloud-based solution that integrates a
variety of hardware for you to plan and manage the visitor experience.  

Visitor management can begin even before a person enters the building. Your
can enter planned visits into an electronic logbook and send customized access
information to guests.

Once a person arrives, they can check-in at a self-serve kiosk where they can
be asked to complete a screening questionnaire, or they can be welcomed at
reception where their ID is scanned, and a visitor pass issued. You can also
integrate the solution into your access control system to grant temporary
access to parts of your facility.  

A visitor management system also helps you keep track of who is in your
facility, while also helping you keep sensitive information secure. You’ll
have analytics on who’s visiting and visitor volumes, and gain insight into
trends and patterns.

Why is visitor management important?

Creating an environment where your customers and employees feel safe and
secure is extremely important. Visitor Management is the process of keeping
track of who is on-site so that everyone can feel more confident that visitors
have been consistently processed and screened to ensure compliance and
increased safety.

Can I integrate a visitor management solution with my existing security
system?

Yes, our visitor management solution can integrate with your existing access
control and identity systems, including human resources, email and calendar,
mass notification and guest Wi-Fi management systems. You will benefit from
avoiding costly rip and replace activities to extend the usability of your
current technologies. An access control system that integrates with a visitor
management system can be a powerful combination to help you give or take away
access for a visitor, to ultimately keep areas of the facility secure.

How do you manage visitors?

Your approach to visitor management starts with defining your goals. Are you
tying to facilitate timed meetings or events? Do you need to screen for
security and health? Is it important to create highly personalized and
customized experiences? What is your need for insight and analytics into the
visitor experience?

Once you have answered these questions, you can create visitor management
procedures and implement the right visitor management technology tailored to
your organization. For example, to assess the health of new entrants, you can
have health questionnaires or a temperature screening system. If you want to
deploy touchless screening systems, set up mobile card readers to scan I.D.s.

Why is an automated visitor management system better than a manual one?

The biggest advantage of automating visitor management is that it accurately
identifies and tracks visitors, keeping your building secure and your
employees safe. An automated system drives operational efficiencies by
reducing administrative costs including any costs associated with a potential
security breach, along with saving time. An automated software allows you to
identify anyone who is in your building at any time and to help ensure
compliance. Additionally, you have access to data to analyze and understand
visitor patterns or be able to search history. Having visitor management
automated allows visitors as they enter your lobby a more pleasant on-site
experience along with a seamless pre-registration experience.

What to look for in a visitor management system?

When you’re choosing a visitor management system, confirm that it will
accomplish—and hopefully exceed—your security and monitoring goals.  

Go beyond standalone systems—your system should be easy to integrate with your
other security platforms, such as fire detection and access control.
Scalability is also essential. You’ll want your system to support your
organization’s evolving needs, including expanding to other sites.  

What are visitor management techniques?

Security is just one aspect of successful visitor management. Fundamentally,
visitor management is about creating the right experience for your visitors
and empowering your staff to deliver great experiences time after time. Map
out your desired visitor touchpoints and then determine how they will happen.

For example, you may want a visitor kiosk where people can fill out pre-
registration forms. The system can notify employees who are expecting a
visitor when they arrive. You can also verify if the visitor is approved to
come in by checking it against a prohibited visitors list.  

Cloud and mobile devices can help to streamline the identification process.
Also decide if you want screening technology to identify people through face
masks or check their temperature.  

Turn to your visitor management technology to enable automation and digitize
manual processes for accuracy and efficiency. Your goal? A positive, safe, and
inviting visitor experience.

© 2023 Securitas Technology

This website uses cookies to enhance user experience and to analyze
performance and traffic on our website. We also share information about your
use of our site with our social media, advertising and analytics partners.

Do Not Sell My Personal Information Accept Cookies

## Do Not Share My Personal Information

Your Opt Out Preference Signal is Honored

  * ### Your Privacy

  * ### Strictly Necessary Cookies

  * ### Functional Cookies

  * ### Performance Cookies

  * ### Targeting Cookies

  * ### Social Media Cookies

#### Your Privacy

When you visit our website, we store cookies on your browser to collect
information. The information collected might relate to you, your preferences
or your device, and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to
and to provide a more personalized web experience. However, you can choose not
to allow certain types of cookies, which may impact your experience of the
site and the services we are able to offer. Click on the different category
headings to find out more and change our default settings according to your
preference. You cannot opt-out of our First Party Strictly Necessary Cookies
as they are deployed in order to ensure the proper functioning of our website
(such as prompting the cookie banner and remembering your settings, to log
into your account, to redirect you when you log out, etc.). For more
information about the First and Third Party Cookies used please follow this
link.  
More information

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched
off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by
you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy
preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block
or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then
work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and
personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose
services we have added to our pages.    If you do not allow these cookies then
some or all of these services may not function properly.

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure
and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are
the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All
information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If
you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our
site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They
may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show
you relevant adverts on other sites.    They do not store directly personal
information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet
device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted
advertising.

#### Social Media Cookies

Social Media Cookies

These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added
to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks.
They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a
profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on
other websites you visit.    If you do not allow these cookies you may not be
able to use or see these sharing tools.
